result.execSummary:
The defendant Donell L Bailey was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Repeater, Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Costs to be paid $50.00 per month commencing 10/01/2022 and each month thereafter on the 1st of each month or penalty of civil judgment for non-payment.

With Huber (standard conditions) Concurrent to 22CF665. 78 days credit.
07/21/2022 COURT ORDERS THE DEFENDANT'S HUBER PRIVILEGES REVOKED.  BALANCE OF THE SENTENCE IS TO BE SERVED STRAIGHT TIME.
Concurrent with: Case 22CF665

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

12:16 PM Defendant Donell L Bailey in court, in custody, with attorney Jessica A Klein.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Victim rights have been complied with by the Waukesha County District Attorneys Office.

22CT307 dismissed as read-in to this case.

Defendant enters a plea of no-contest to count#2.
Court finds the Defendant guilty of count#2.
Counts #1 and #3 are dismissed and read-in.

Court orders the following:	
150 Days in the Waukesha County Jail, with Huber release (standard conditions)
78 Days Credit.  
CONCURRENT TO 22CF665

Costs:  $243.00
DV surcharge $100.00
DNA Sample and Surcharge:  $200.00
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
To be paid at the rate of $50.00 per month, starting 10/01/2022 and the 1st of every month until paid in full.
Alternate: entry of civil judgment

Plea/sentencing hearing on June 30, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Letter from Attorney Klein requesting to move the plea/sentencing hearings to an earlier date.
Plea/sentencing hearing on July 21, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant Donell L Bailey in court, in custody, with attorney Jessica A Klein.   Peter Michael Tempelis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Victim rights have been complied with by the Waukesha County District Attorneys Office. Victim is present in courtroom. 

Defense looking for plea/sentencing hearing. Hearing set. Hearing works for victim.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 21, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Hearing on May 19, 2022 at 10:30 am.

Abbey Nickolie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Donell L Bailey in court with attorney Jessica A Klein.  
Court to Address:  Defense Motion to Modify Bond (Requesting a Signature Bond and to Convert the No Contact with Victim A to No Violent Contact with Victim A).
Victim A appeared in person in court.

Defense presented bail arguments to the court.
Victim A presented statements to the court - Wants contact with the defendant.

Court Denies - Defense Motion for Bail Modification.
Reasons placed on the record.  Hearing scheduled for May 19, 2022 at 10:30 am.

10:25 AM Defendant Donell L Bailey in court, in custody, with attorney Jessica A Klein.   Zachary A Wittchow appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Victim A is not present.

The Court calls the matter for the Defense's Motion to Modify Bail.
The State objects to hearing the motion as vicitm notification was not completed.
The Court will adjourn the Motion hearing to the Trial Court.

10:08 AM Defendant Donell L Bailey in court, in custody, with attorney Jessica A Klein.   Zachary A Wittchow appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

The Court conducts a colloquy with the Defense.
The Defendant requests a prelim hearing.
The Court conducts a hearing:

Officer Ryan Solberg, of the City of Waukesha Police Department, sworn in and testifies on direct by ADA Wittchow.
Cross examination by attorney Klein.
The witness is excused and the State rests.
The Defense rests with no testimony proffered.
The Court deems testimony closed.

The State moves for bind over.
The Defense moves to dismiss count 1. 
The Court denies the dismissal request.
Court finds probable cause to believe that a felony was committed and binds the defendant over for trial.

Waive reading of Information.  
NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.
Bail remains as fixed.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for April 25, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Motion to Modify Bail, filed by Attorney Klein.
Preliminary hearing on April 20, 2022 at 09:15 am.

01:10 PM Defendant Donell L Bailey in court with attorney Jessica A Klein.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty. Klein requests bail be modified.  State objects.  Court denies the modification of bail conditions.    Bail remains as fixed.  Date remains as previously set.  Victim was in the gallery, but the court was not notified that the victim was in the gallery.
Defendant's Demand for Discovery.

Letter from victim A. requesting a bail modification.
  **Reviewed by Commissioner Daniel Rieck on 03/28/22. To address at defendant's next hearing on 04/13

Motion and Order To Seal Victim/Witness Identification Key.
Signed by Judge Brad D. Schimel on 03/07/22.
Preliminary hearing on April 20, 2022 at 09:15 am.

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Defendant to have no contact with individuals listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney.    Defendant to report to WCS the first business day after their release from custody.  Defendant to comply with GPS monitoring through Wisconsin Community Services.  Defendant is not to come within 0.5 mile of Victim A, listed in the Victim Identification Key, or their residence, employment, school or anywhere they frequent.  Defendant is not to possess any dangerous weapons/firearms.

03:11 PM Defendant Donell L Bailey in court, in custody, with attorney Ricardo Tapia.   Christian Farina appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  Defendant is eligible for State Public Defender representation.  An attorney will be appointed.  Preliminary Hearing requested.  Preliminary time limits waived.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 20, 2022 at 09:15 am.
